page.title: 13transport
page.content: A complex communication system exists within and between the sites on Teesside. This is especially true of the chemical sites. Grid systems of roads with control and check points allow site traffic mobility. Most significant, however, is the surface network of liquid and gas pipelines. Thrse transport crude oil, ethylene, benzene, water, brine, ammonia, naptha and steam uner pressure. Shell Oil U.K. and B.S.C. have rail-lines - Shell Oil standard gauge, B.S.C. narrow gauge. Pipelines exist beneath the River Tees, linking the N. and S. Tees I.C.I. plants and transferring mainly naptha, ehtylene and ammonia.
